pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.26: This set of eight qualities is also found at [](an8.52:0.3).
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.16: “Are you all present” render _samaggāttha_, lit. “are you united”. [Sp.2.149](): _Samaggātthāti sabbā āgatatthāti attho_, “Are you united: the meaning is ‘Have you all come?’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.18: _Niyyādetabbo_. For the meaning of this word in this context, see the usage in the origin story to the next rule, [](pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.9), and the explanations at [Sp.2.149](): _Niyyādetabboti appetabbo_ and _Ovādaṃ aniyyādetvāti eso bhaginiyo ovādoti avatvā_.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.20: _Sāmīcikammaṃ_. [Sp.2.149](): _sāmīcikammanti maggasampadānabījanapānīyāpucchanādikaṃ anucchavikavattaṃ_, “_Sāmīcikammaṃ_ means appropriate duties such as giving way, fanning, and offering drinking water, etc.” This seems to be covered well by “acts of respect”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.22: The Pali word behind the translation “monastery” is _āvāsa_. This refers to the area within the _simā_, the boundary, as established through a legal procedure. This area may be much larger than the space occupied by any actual buildings.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.30: Heavy offense, _garudhamma_, here refers to the _saṅghādisesa_ offenses, the offenses entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.36: “Correct” is for _vacanapatha_. For the meaning of this word see “Bhikkhuni Vinaya Studies”, by Bhikkhu Sujato, pp.73-76.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.38: This seems to say that if the nuns are all present then the monk must always give an _ovāda_ that consists in teaching the eight _garudhammas_.This, however, needs to be seen in light of the further subdivision given in the text above, where the instruction in the _garudhammas_ is to be given only when the nuns say they are not practicing them.If the nuns are practicing the _garudhammas_, there seems to be no restriction on the nature of the _ovāda_.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.40: According to [Sp.2.149](): _Ovādaṃ aniyyādetvāti eso bhaginiyo ovādoti avatvā_ “_Ovādaṃ aniyyādetvā_: not having said: ‘Sisters, this is the instruction.’” This, however, seems contrived. A more natural meaning might be to see this statement in conjunction with the previous one, and the two together might then be paraphrased as follows: If the nuns say they are not all present, then one should not instruct in the eight rules to be respected, nor in any other teaching. In any case, once “Sisters, this is the instruction” has been said, it seems any teaching can be given; see [](pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.9).
